fases.mensaje: Please read these suggestions. They can be helpful
sugerencias: Try to determine, in as much detail as possible, the client's needs, and ask any questions that help you determine if you want to work with that client or not

Find out where they live, gather information about their family members to contact in case of an emergency (this will also be useful for you in case your employer exposes you to labor abuses that are not allowed by law, such as labor exploitation, not receiving the agreed compensation in the employment contract, humiliation, yelling, among others)

titulos: If you feel you are receiving inappropriate treatment from your employer
When the personnel finish their tasks
If you decide not to continue working with the client
parrafos: Request your employment contract in writing, as this is the document that certifies that you are working for the client.
Ensure good personal hygiene and refrain from smoking, consuming alcoholic beverages, or engaging in behaviors that go against morals and good customs, especially in front of children.

Ask the client about security procedures for opening doors, answering the phone, receiving visitors in the property, and any other matters related to the individuals under your care or the property where you will be working.

Request contact information from the client regarding the individuals under your care, such as the attending physician, phone numbers of insurance companies covering the individuals, a list of nearby clinics for emergencies, direct contact details for the client and for you in case of any emergencies or inquiries from the hired person or yourself.

If possible, record the fingerprints of the personnel serving you as a basis for accountability in case of theft or any incidents that the person may have caused in the property or towards the individuals under your care.

Strive to maintain good communication with the individuals under your care in a friendly and respectful manner, and do your job to the best of your ability. Be attentive to their needs. Remember that your employer is placing their trust in you, and there is no better way to repay that trust than by doing a job well and ensuring the well-being of the people you are caring for.
Maintain regular communication with your employer and request feedback on the work you are performing.

Discuss the situation with your employer and determine if things can improve. If the situation does not improve, you have the option to leave if you wish. In this case, no employer can detain you by force, as it is a crime. Additionally, there are other organizations that defend workers' rights in case of labor exploitation or unsuitable working conditions, to which you should present your employment contract and payment receipts.

Request a payment receipt from the client to have evidence of the payments received. This document, along with the employment contract, serves as proof to the competent authorities that you have an employment relationship with the client and allows them to assist you if you encounter any problems related to labor exploitation or non-payment by your employer.
Show your bag before leaving the workplace.
Give advance notice so that the client can find another person. This also helps to leave a good reference with the client.
Store valuable jewelry or belongings in secure places.
